events.title: Cuts in global aid could result in 22.6 million excess deaths by 2030

events.title: The people betting on catastrophic world events â€“ podcast
events.description: Prediction markets allow you to put money on everything from the US attacking Iran to Jesus returning. Saahil Desai explains their dizzying rise In the early hours of 3 January, Donald Trump ordered a surprise attack on the Venezuelan capital, Caracas, to kidnap the countryâ€™s leader, NicolÃ¡s Maduro. Millions of Venezuelansâ€™ lives were thrown into uncertainty. Politicians at home and abroad scrambled to respond. It seemed this was something no one had seen coming. Except one person did actually predict it. In the hours before the attack, someone - and we have no way of knowing who - placed a series of bets that Donald Trump would oust Maduro on a prediction market platform, netting them nearly $500,000 when it happened. These platforms allow their users not just to bet on whoeverâ€™s going to win the Super Bowl, but also on world events. Heavily regulated under the Biden administration, these apps have enjoyed a huge boom in popularity since Trump came to power. Continue reading...

events.ticker_label: ğŸª– 'More relevant every day' in the U.S.: A filmmaker documented Russia's journalists

events.title: The Winter Olympics get 8 new events, including the first new sport in decades
events.description: Ski mountaineering will make its Olympic debut this year, the first winter sport to do so since 2002. Skeleton, luge, ski jumping and moguls are also getting new events.

events.title: As Trump reshapes foreign policy, China moves to limit risks, reap gains
events.description: President Trump's focus overseas may spare China for now, but Beijing still worries that his "America First" rhetoric hasn't softened what it calls U.S. "military adventurism."

events.title: US ambassador cuts ties with Polish parliament speaker
events.description: The diplomatic row comes after Sejm speaker Czarzasty said Donald Trump didn't "deserve" the Nobel Peace Prize. Poland is one of the US' closest allies in Europe and lies on NATO's eastern flank.

events.title: Epstein files show Norwegian ex-PM Jagland's ties to sex offender
events.description: Police have requested the revocation of Thorbjorn Jagland's immunity linked to his past position as a senior diplomat. He is among many high-profile figures facing scrutiny after the latest Epstein files release.

events.title: Louvre to fully restore Empress Eugenie's crown after heist
events.description: The Louve theves dropped Empress Eugenie's emerald crown when they fled the scene of the heist in October last year, leaving it badly dented. But the eight pieces they got away with still have not been found.

events.title: Russia expels German diplomat in tit-for-tat espionage row
events.description: Russia has declared a military attache at the German Embassy in Moscow persona non grata. It called the move a response to Germany expelling a diplomat and accusing them of espionage, a charge the Kremlin rejects.

events.title: Trump administration launches TrumpRx to lower prescription drug costs
events.description: The Trump administration unveiled TrumpRx on Thursday, a website aimed at helping Americans access discounted prescription drugs directly from manufacturers. The initiative, part of broader efforts to tackle rising health care costs, includes weight-loss and fertility medications.

events.title: France's rugby team overpowers Ireland in Six Nations title defence
events.description: France sent a clear message in their Six Nations opener, overpowering Ireland 36â€“14 at the Stade de France to collect a bonus point. Five tries, led by Louis Bielle-Biarrey, put the champions in firm control early, before Irelandâ€™s late rally proved too little, too late on a rain-soaked night as their title defence began in emphatic style.

events.title: Japanese PM 'in enviable position' ahead of snap election, expert says
events.description: Japan's 64-year-old PM â Sanae Takaichi, leader of the Liberal Democratic Party, has sparked an unlikely youth-led craze that could propel her to a big election win. Speaking with FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney, Amy Catalinac, Associate Professor of Politics at New York University, says that Takaichi has "high support rates across the generations" and "a large share of so-called 'floating voters' are looking like they're going to support the LDP on Sunday".

events.title: Italy's tourism industry welcomes Olympic visitors
events.description: Businesses across Italy could see a windfall of some $6 billion, as spectators head to the Alps for the Winter Olympics. The Milano-Cortina 2026 Games have run over-budget, although by a smaller amount than previous competitions. Giulia Wedam, Co-Founder & CEO of the tourism agency Cortina IN, says she's expecting a boost in business that will outlast the Games themselves.

events.title: Doctored emails online claim Jeffrey Epstein invented Bitcoin
events.description: Social media users falsely claimed that emails from the latest Epstein file dump prove that the disgraced sex offender was in fact Satoshi Nakamoto, the creator of Bitcoin whose real identity remains a mystery to this day. Satoshi Nakamoto is indeed mentioned in the documents, but this particular viral email is doctored. Vedika Bahl explains in Truth or Fake.

events.title: How a Jewish familyâ€™s Baghdad home became Franceâ€™s rent-free embassy
events.description: A Paris court on Monday dismissed a lawsuit brought by the descendants of an Iraqi Jewish family seeking compensation for a Baghdad villa occupied rent-free by France's diplomatic representation for decades. Forced to flee Iraq amid rising anti-Semitism in the late 1940s, the family said it will appeal the ruling.

events.title: Historic crown crushed during Louvre heist pictured
events.description: The crown of French Empress Eugenie recovered after last year's Louvre heist was left damaged - but remains largely intact and will be restored, the museum has said.

events.title: Don't boo the Americans, Olympics boss tells spectators
events.description: Even without coming to the Winter Olympics in Italy, Donald Trump and his polarising policies and provocations are dominating, even distracting.

events.title: Winter Olympics hit by penis enhancement controversy
events.description: Crotch enhancements. Banned helmets. Qualifying manipulation claims. And Russian hacking.

events.title: 7 Toronto police officers arrested over suspected ties to organized crime
events.description: Authorities have arrested seven Toronto police officers and one retired officer over suspected ties to organized crime

events.description: Queen MÃ¡xima of the Netherlands has started training to become a reserve member of the Dutch army

events.title: As winter comes, so does garbage. A river in Bosnia chokes in tons of waste year after year
events.description: Each year the Drina River in eastern Bosnia is filled with waste brought downstream from illegal dump sites

events.title: UK leader apologizes to victims of Epstein for giving Mandelson an ambassador job
events.description: Keir Starmer never met Jeffrey Epstein

events.title: Questions around a compound of refugees from Syria show lingering post-Assad fears
events.description: A compound in Lebanon housing people who fled Syria after Bashar Assad's fall has faced allegations of harboring Assad loyalists, which residents deny

events.title: Malaysia bans e-waste imports, vows to end illegal dumping
events.description: Malaysia has announced a full ban on importing electronic waste

events.title: Fatwas, faith and fallacies: Myth-busting female genital mutilation in Africa
events.description: Olivia Albert, 19, was subjected to female genital (FGM) mutilation when she was 14. She told the UN sexual and reproductive health agency (UNFPA) that she hid her pain because everyone around her said it was normal.

events.title: Teens charged in $66M crypto home invasion plot in Scottsdale as search for Nancy Guthrie continues in Tucson
events.description: Two California teens were arrested in an alleged $66 million crypto-related Arizona home invasion just before Nancy Guthrie vanished. Authorities have not said if the cases are linked.

events.title: US special envoy Witkoff announces US, Ukrainian and Russian delegations agree to prisoner swap
events.description: The U.S., Ukrainian, and Russian delegations have agreed to an exchange of 314 prisoners, according to U.S. special envoy Steve Witkoff's office.

events.title: UK to release files related to former ambassador's Jeffrey Epstein ties
events.description: U.K. government commits to releasing files on Peter Mandelson's appointment as ambassador to the U.S. despite his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.
